						IN DEFENCE OF YOUTUBE







						Websites such as YouTube have come under fire today for not doing enough to discourage cyber-bullies.


Meanwhile, web pioneer Tim O'Reilly has drawn up a draft code of conduct on blogging that suggests readers should be warned if they are about to be exposed to "crude language". 


In tonight's programme, we'll attempt to redress some of the negative press new technology has been getting.  We'll look at some of the creative efforts the technology has been unleashing, and the increasing craze on sites such as YouTube for posting re-enactments of famous scenes from films.


To whet your appetite, below is a YouTube link to one man's one-man Goodfellas cyber-homage.  Here's your opportunity to get into a spot of afternoon wilfing, and we'd like to point out that the clip contains strong language from the outset.


http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yLje9McwxvA&NR

Newsnight, presented by Gavin Esler, returns from its Easter slumber tonight at 10.30pm on BBC TWO.
